question: The binding energy per nucleon for C-12 is 7.68 MeV and that for C-13 is 7.47 MeV. The energy required to remove a neutron from C-13 is:
explanation: Total BE(C13) = 13 * 7.47 = 97.11 MeV. Total BE(C12) = 12 * 7.68 = 92.16 MeV. Energy to remove neutron = BE(C13) - BE(C12) = 97.11 - 92.16 = 4.95 MeV. Wait. Binding energy is energy released when formed. To remove neutron, we supply energy to break C13 into C12 + n. Energy balance: C13 + E -> C12 + n. Mass(C13) + E_m = Mass(C12) + Mass(n). E = [M(C12)+Mn - M(C13)]c^2. BE = [ZMp+NMn - M]c^2 => M = ZMp+NMn - BE. M(C13) = 6Mp+7Mn - BE13. M(C12) = 6Mp+6Mn - BE12. E = [6Mp+6Mn-BE12 + Mn - (6Mp+7Mn-BE13)] = BE13 - BE12. Correct.
subject: Physics
